this Thursday marks the start of the annual United Way charity fundraising drive which aims to raise  for approximately  local programs PERIOD

University faculty and staff United Way volunteers and local businesses will team up to raise funds for the associations sponsored by United Way in Santa Barbara including the local Boys  Girls Club the visiting nurse programs and the Isla Vista Youth Project PERIOD

UCSB Director of Business Services Pam Lombardo said the bulk of the money raised during the event will come from the personal contributions by staff members PERIOD She also said that volunteers from almost every university department will work to encourage their peers to pledge funds during the drive which ends Feb PERIOD  PERIOD In order to maximize participation Lombardo coordinated with local businesses many of which have donated coupons as raffle prizes for donors PERIOD

Among the campaign sponsors is Woodstocks Pizza which Lombardo said was particularly active in helping to promote the drive PERIOD Woodstocks Director of Business Development John Francis said that when he and the owners of Woodstocks learned about the fundraiser they were impressed with the high level of participation by UCSB staff and faculty PERIOD

When Pam Lombardo told us that nine percent of faculty were giving money from their paychecks for this cause we asked if we could do more to help too Francis said PERIOD One of the weaknesses of the event is that faculty is participating and not really the students and they may not even know about it. to raise money and increase student involvement with the United Way drive Woodstocks will host a fundraiser kickoff party on Tuesday Jan PERIOD  from  to  p.m. during which time it will donate  percent of sales to the charity PERIOD Additionally every Thursday during the event  of every  purchase from its Arbor location on campus will go toward the charity PERIOD

United Way representatives will also set up booths nearby in the Arbor to offer students more information on ways they can help Francis said PERIOD

According to Lombardo the nearly sixweek United Way campaign will also include a Volunteer Day scheduled for Feb PERIOD  during which UCSB faculty staff and students are encouraged to donate their time to the United Waysupported Isla Vista Youth Center PERIOD

In addition to coordinating with local businesses United Way volunteers were working closely with the Office of Student Life to educate staff and students about volunteer and charity programs within the Santa Barbara community PERIOD OSL Assistant Director of Firstyear Programs and Leadership Education Miles Ashlock said he has served as a liaison between United Way campaign coordinators and the various departments of student life PERIOD

Ashlock said that in addition to driving faculty participation within departments he was working to educate people on campus about the various programs United Way supports in the community PERIOD

One of the most salient things that attracts donators on campus is United Ways strong connection with the Isla Vista Youth Foundation whose programs hit home for a lot of faculty and staff Ashlock said PERIOD

Ashlock described the IVYF as a constellation of programs for youth living in Isla Vista ranging from childcare services to health and parenting education programs PERIOD Ashlock said he hopes to organize a discussion of United Ways various activities within the community at the upcoming Student Leadership Conference on Jan PERIOD  PERIOD

United Way of Santa Barbara is a volunteerrun organization that has operated in Santa Barbara County since  PERIOD It supports various local programs focused on children seniors families and community building PERIOD
